articles.description: A star for Steph? Shooters for the Thunder? Which NBA contenders have holes -- and how they can fix them.
articles.headline: NBA trade deadline: Biggest roster holes for 15 contenders -- and the chance each makes a major move

images.name: nba_steph-curry_01.JPG [1296x729]
images.caption: Steph Curry is in his 16th year in the league. "I want to do this for as long as I can," he says. "But the clock's ticking. We all know that."

images.name: nba_steph-curry_02.JPG [3000x1999]
images.caption: The Warriors are trying to maximize their star's time on the court without wearing him down.

images.name: nba_steph-curry_03.JPG [1470x3000]
images.caption: "It's picking and choosing your spots and trying to manage an 82-game schedule and hopefully get to a playoff series where you're fresh," Curry says.

images.name: nba_steph-curry_04.JPG [3000x2186]
images.caption: Coach Steve Kerr works with Curry on his minutes. "I'm fine with admitting a big part of my job is not running Steph into the ground," Kerr says.

images.name: nba_steph-curry_05.JPG [1461x3000]
images.caption: A big topic of debate around the Warriors is how they've constructed their roster to help maximize Curry with an eye on another title.

images.name: nba_steph-curry_06.JPG [1821x3000]
images.caption: After struggling in the 2016 Finals against the Cavaliers, Curry dedicated himself to the weight room.

images.name: nba_steph-curry_07.JPG [2757x3000]
images.caption: Curry is the NBA's best shooter, leading the league in 3s a record eight times with the highest free throw percentage in NBA history.

images.name: nba_steph-curry_08.JPG [3000x2202]
images.caption: Curry celebrates a win against the Timberwolves in San Francisco.

images.name: Is time running out to maximize Steph Curry's window?
images.caption: Bobby Marks and Chiney Ogwumike break down how the Warriors can improve to extend Steph Curry's championship window.

articles.description: As the Warriors are determined to play him less, they confront a harsh reality: They need him more than ever.
articles.headline: Steph Curry and the NBA's most confounding paradox
